snippet: Two men tricked investors out of $96 million, diverting it to a Long Island resort. But in a twist that stands to help their victims, that investment now looks like a winner.
abstract: Investors in Ponzi scheme run by Brian R Callahan and his brother-in-law Adam Manson may recoup some money as real estate prices soar in Montauk, NY; men had purchased Panoramic View resort with some of money they claimed to be investing in hedge funds, and investment has seen strong returns.
lead_paragraph: Two men tricked investors out of $96 million, diverting it to a Long Island resort. But in a twist that stands to help their victims, that investment now looks like a winner.

headline.main: Real Estate Investment Aided by Ponzi Scheme Could Recoup Victims’ Money
headline.print_headline: Semi-Happy Ending, Seaside, for Long Island Ponzi Scheme

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Panoramic View Resort and Residences (Montauk, NY)
